data.title: Access to SampleLibrary size() - feature proposal
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
v2.0.3.stable.official

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
A feature proposal.
I wanted to know on runtime the size of a SampleLibrary content to play a random sample.
Therefore I can't find a way to get the size of samples (sound files) inside a SampleLibrary in script.
It'll be nice to have a 'size()' or a 'count()' or even a 'play_random()'

**Steps to reproduce:**

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

And those lines, are a workaround to make possible edit range properties by dragging.
- [collision_shape_2d.cpp](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/7999b07e4f01e6e247fa10f39d04ebdbe121c415/scene/2d/collision_shape_2d.cpp#L49-L51)
- [body_shape.cpp](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/7999b07e4f01e6e247fa10f39d04ebdbe121c415/scene/3d/body_shape.cpp#L53-L55)

data.title: Added drag and drop to rearrange the autoload order
data.body:
- Added drag and drop support to the autoload settings(only to rearrange the autoload order). Notice that the move up and move down buttons still there.
- Moved the autoload settings from the ProjectSettings source file to it's own file, and it's own class Class(EditorAutoloadSettings).

closes #3543.

data.title: Godot I/O; Functionality that merges the re-imported Blender scene with scene instances already in place
data.body:
A picture says a thousand words
![godot_proposal1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10081256/16569560/8d8f7794-41fd-11e6-89c3-9ba188c8205f.jpg)

Now I'm not asking we need to try to reintroduce the old merge commands in full, but the merging in question which I am proposing would _only_ apply to merging in instances of other scenes already in place. The idea would be that this approach would greatly reduce the complexity in making a functional merge possible because scene instances are entirely self-contained and it would be far easier for Godot to determine how to add them back (unlike the 1.x series where the code may have to figure out complex non-instanced hierarchies added to the scene). In other words, non-instanced nodes added to the scene would still disappear (and as such Godot wouldn't have to deal with them).

I guess it could or could not be explained better (hence why I added the image)

Thoughts?

data.title: Fix crash when null value through jni on android
Link libdl only on Linux, fix BSD build
data.body: BSDs don't need (nor have) libdl

data.title: Open in Help show blank page if multiple nodes are selected
data.body:
**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Add some nodes to the scene.
2. Select more than one.
3. Click on the gear button in the Inspector and select "Open in Help"
4. See the blank page.

This happens even if the selected nodes are of the same type.

data.title: Fix TreeItem range editing by dragging on the inspector
data.body:
Fix the Tree class don't allowing to edit  a TreeItem spinbox via draggring, when the range cell mode is `CELL_MODE_RANGE_EXPRESSION`.

closes #4608.

data.title: Fix EditorPlugin::forward_spatial_input_event in GDScripts addons
data.body:
Fix the function:

``` cpp
bool EditorPlugin::forward_spatial_input_event(Camera* camera,const InputEvent& event);
```

In GDScript addons, the camera parameter is receiving a bool value, due to incomplete type, instead of a pointer to the viewport camera.

data.title: Fix addon disabling
data.body:
Fix a crash that happens when disabling a addon from the project settings. It happens when the plugin overrides the handles function, for example:

``` GDScript
# You can test this issue, by adding this function to the "Custom Dock" plugin
func handles(object):
    return object extends Node
```

If plugin is "active" when the user disable it, the editor will crash. Notice that the crash don't happens immediately, you need to trigger it by passing the cursor over the 2D or the 3D viewport, or creating a new scene.

data.title: Button focus text color
data.body: Currently you can set the hover text color for a button, but this only triggered by the mouse. It would be nice to have also a focus text color to when the button have the focus gained via keyboard/joystick.

data.title: Undo skips Spinbox increment/decrement operations
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 7 x64 - 2rc1

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
After using the increment/decrement buttons on a spinbox multiple times, using undo will only negate the most recent interaction, then skipping other spinbox interactions and reverting prior actions.

**Steps to reproduce:**
In the editor place a TextureFrame.
Perform a series of undoable actions.
In the inspector, change an attribute of the TextureFrame by clicking on a Spinbox increment button several times.
Perform several undo operations, the most recent increment will be undone, then the prior series of undoable actions will be undone, skipping over the initial Spinbox increments.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

data.title: draw_polygon() is unaffected by Node's opacity
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 8.1 x64 - Godot 2.0.3 (stable)

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Primitive drawn using draw_polygon() is unaffected by Node's opacity.
From top to bottom:
draw_line()
draw_rect()
draw_polygon()
![draw_polygon_opacity_bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5756107/16559497/e6f6272c-41f5-11e6-9be2-7a6722a65f95.jpg)

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. start new project, add Node2D node as root, save scene, set it as main.
2. add new script to Node2D root node
3. paste this into script:
func _ready():
    update()

func _draw():
    var offsetX = 20.0
    var offsetY = 20.0
    var size = 100.0
    var color = Color(1.0,0.0,0.0)

```
draw_line(Vector2(offsetX, offsetY), Vector2(offsetX + size, offsetY), color)

draw_rect(Rect2(Vector2(offsetX, offsetY + size), Vector2(size, size)), color)

var pos = [Vector2(offsetX, offsetY + size * 3), Vector2(offsetX + size, offsetY + size * 3 ),
           Vector2(offsetX + size, offsetY + size * 4), Vector2(offsetX, offsetY + size * 4)]
draw_polygon(pos, [color, color, color, color])
```
1. save script.
2. set root Node2D node's opacity to 0.5.
3. run scene.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
http://www39.zippyshare.com/v/fM6dEDl2/file.html

data.title: Editor crashes when alt-tabbing out of it or closing a running project
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
- Arch Linux, Clang 3.8.0
- Godot Git https://github.com/godotengine/godot/commit/576a28470fce95cf0d35d5e2e1e408b4afe80e4f

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):

The editor crashes when performing an alt-tab action outwards of it (when it's maximized) or when closing a project that is running (as a child process, ie. press <kbd>F5</kbd> then <kbd>Alt+F4</kbd>).

data.title: Sprites showing multiple times
data.body:
I made a scene containing two sprites which represent mouse cursors.
Depending on the state, one sprite will hide and the other will continue to show.
The states change depending on which function is called

Now, when I launch the game and I click on a region that is supposed to call one of these function, the sprites actually changes but not the duplicates.

I've seen this bug before when I tried to change the position of a sprite but it's duplicate was staying in the 0, 0 coordinates. 

Where these duplicates come from ?

Here is the code of the mouse scene :

```
extends Node2D

var is_patch = true
var has_focus = false

func _ready():
    set_fixed_process(true)
    set_z(99)
    state_default()
    print(get_child_count())

func _fixed_process(delta):
    if is_patch:
        get_node("outline").set_global_pos(get_node("/root/main").get_mouse_pos())
    else:
        get_node("pointer").set_global_pos(get_node("/root/main").get_mouse_pos())

    if has_focus:
        get_node("pointer").show()
    else:
        get_node("pointer").hide()

########################
## Funcs
########################

func state_default():
    is_patch = true
    has_focus = false

func state_focus():
    is_patch = true
    has_focus = true

func state_active():
    is_patch = false
    has_focus = true
```

data.title: Fixed shortcuts saving issues, fixes #5373
data.body:
Pros:
- shortcuts assigned by the user are now persistent
- In case a shortcut is removed from code, user shortcuts remain the same (contrary to the current behavior were all the shortcuts will be removed)

Cons:
- legacy shortcuts could pile up in the editor settings (not a big deal since the file only grows some KB, and shortcut deprecation wont change that often)

data.title: Unix OS driver: static function has_data() useless?
Editing a built-in script won't update unless containing scene is saved
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Ubuntu Linux 16.04 64b, Godot built from ac157f8

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
If you have a script that's built-in and modify it from the editor, while another scene is focused, changes won't take effect unless the scene containing the built-in script is saved. This can become kind of confusing when doing minute changes and not seeing them reflected in the project.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1 - Create a built-in script in a sub-scene, leave it in the script editor, then save the scene.
2 - Move to another scene and instance the sub-scene with the built-in script.
3 - Edit the built-in script and save it with ctrl+S (_even if this saves the scene, it also saves scripts being edited even if it doesn't belong to that scene, so it's easy to forget_)
4 - Run the scene with the instanced sub-scene. Changes won't be reflected.
5 - Re-focus the sub-scene and save it.
6 - Now it works.

platform/x11/joystick_linux.cpp:48:20: warning: 'ignore_str' defined but not used [-Wunused-variable]

Those variables are generated by `methods.py` at compilation time, but are apparently not needed. I'm not confident enough with the way this Python script works to get rid of those though, they seemed to be necessary under specific configurations.

data.title: Can use AtlasTextures as custom mouse cursor.
data.body: fixes #3957

data.title: Script properties interfer with the node
data.body:
Tested on Godot 2.0.3 on Windows 10 64 bits

I wrote a simple script to render a laser pointer and put it on a `Sprite` node.
However, as soon as I reloaded the scene, the sprite was unexpectedly offset.
It turns out my `laser_pointer.gd` script had an `offset` variable, which already exists in `Sprite`.
Both `offset` fields were deserialized to the value from the script, and I lost the previous value my sprite originally had.

![unexpected_shadowed_variable](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1311555/16546343/aeb438b2-4147-11e6-821b-4c9c185d8dc9.png)

In the scene file you can see this:

```
[node name="arm" type="Sprite" parent="pivot"]

z/z = -1
texture = ExtResource( 2 )
centered = false
offset = Vector2( 0.1234, 0 ) <-----------------------------------
region = true
region_rect = Rect2( 0, 39, 89, 36 )
script/script = ExtResource( 3 )
color = Color( 1, 0, 0, 0.5 )
flicker_color = Color( 1, 0, 0, 0.3 )
flicker_interval_msec = 100
thickness = 3
offset = Vector2( 0.1234, 0 ) <-----------------------------------
```

Because you can inherit Node2D and still be able to put the script on Sprites, RigidBody or anything, it makes it hard to show a warning in the code editor.
So, we could show a popup when the script is added or when the scene is loaded? Or better, prepend something to the property so it doesn't interfer (`script/stuff`").
Any ideas?

data.title: set_hidden function versus the "Visible" inspector item - naming inconsistency.
data.body:
Godot 2.0.3, OS is N/A.

Looking at the inspector for (for example) the pause_panel node in the pause demo, the property for visibility is called (unsurprisingly) "Visible", set to on or off. But the function is set_hidden (as per http://docs.godotengine.org/en/latest/classes/class_canvasitem.html and other places as well). This is an inconsistency. Renaming the function to set_visible, or the inspector property to "Hidden" would be nice.

data.title: Added search to shortcut config
data.body: Added a search box to shortcut configuration popup.

data.title: .resume() -ing a function causes it to be called again
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 7 - 2.0.3

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
When .resume() -ing a .yield() -ed function, that function is resumed but it is also called again

This means that if you attempt to .yield() and then .resume() _ready(), the game crashes (due to the fact that the game crashes when _ready() is called in scripting after it's initial calling once the script is loaded, which I assume is intentional)

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Create scene with single node with attached script
2. .yield() and then .resume() _ready
3. Observe crashing of game

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
[Yield Test.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/345040/Yield.Test.zip)

data.title: "ld: unknown option: -rpath=$ORIGIN" while building for osx
data.body:
`scons: Building targets ...
/home/user/osxcross/target/bin/i386-apple-darwin15-c++ -o bin/godot.osx.opt.32 -framework Cocoa -framework Carbon -framework OpenGL -framework AGL -framework AudioUnit -lz -Wl,-rpath=\$ORIGIN platform/osx/os_osx.osx.opt.32.o platform/osx/godot_main_osx.osx.opt.32.o platform/osx/audio_driver_osx.osx.opt.32.o platform/osx/sem_osx.osx.opt.32.o platform/osx/dir_access_osx.osx.opt.32.o -Lmodules/libmodules.osx.opt.32.a bin/tests/libtests.osx.opt.32.a drivers/libdrivers.osx.opt.32.a scene/libscene.osx.opt.32.a servers/libservers.osx.opt.32.a core/libcore.osx.opt.32.a -lpthread drivers/freetype/libfreetype_builtin1.osx.opt.32.a drivers/freetype/libfreetype_builtin2.osx.opt.32.a
ld: unknown option: -rpath=$ORIGIN
clang: error: linker command failed with exit code 1 (use -v to see invocation)
scons: *** [bin/godot.osx.opt.32] Error 1
scons: building terminated because of errors.`

Building 32-bit osx templates with osxcross version "darwin14", "darwin15".
Godot github latest version(2.1-alpha)
